description:
Based on an idol-training mobile game produced by Liber Entertainment and Pony Canyon.

The brand-new voice actor office "AiRBLUE" has no track record or experience. Aspiring voice actors with rich individuality are signed on to the office. They do their best to achieve their dreams, but it's a tough world out there. No matter how much they practice, not everyone will pass the audition.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

node.description: Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/). He is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rsknkns)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rsknkns/)__

Ryousuke Nakanishi is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and musician, while also known as the representative director of Altus Inc. and managing director Up Dream Inc. He is also a member of the Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers.

node.description:
__[Website](http://higedriver.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/higedriver)__

Hige Driver, alternatively known as Shingo, is a Japanese vocalist, guitarist, lyricist, composer, arranger and member of HigedriveVAN. He is affiliated with the creator team [Heart's Cry](https://anilist.co/staff/252231/).

On August 10th, 2020, his marriage to voice actress [Ari Ozawa](https://anilist.co/staff/118663) was announced.
